title: Calories in Cooked White Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in cooked white rice per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Long-grain white rice, boiled in water without added salt, oil, or seasonings; drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked white rice provides about 130 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of cooked white rice?
faqs.a: About 205 kcal for 1 cup (158g); scale from 130 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in cooked white rice?
faqs.a: Around 28g carbs per 100g, with minimal fiber (0.4g).

faqs.q: Is cooked white rice high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only about 2.7g protein per 100g; pair with proteins for balance.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in white rice?
faqs.a: Boiled is lowest; frying or adding oil/butter increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: Calories in uncooked vs cooked white rice?
faqs.a: Uncooked is ~360 kcal per 100g; cooking absorbs water, reducing density to ~130 kcal per 100g cooked.
